page.title: 01LANDSCAPE - WORTHEN
page.content: The village of{Worthen}lies on the north side of the valley of the River Rea. It adjoins the village of {Brockton.}Although an old community, in the original Domesday book,it has several small modern housing estates. Worthen is a{farming}area,mainly dairy farming on improved grassland and drained watermeadows (The Moors).{ {Fields }are of medium size and many of the original{hedges}remain. Trees are scattered mainly in the hedgerows but there is some planted{woodland } in the east of the area. From the distance the village is recognised by the square tower of the C12 church, and one green silo at Bank Farm.The area is divided by the Rea and there is only one road-bridge on the B4499.
